messages.message: I’ve added a pull request for a single service - `api-server-apps` - along with a little cleanup of the existing py3 docker file - `api-server` - with @sudeep tagged as the reviewer. But if anyone else wants to take a look and let me know all the things I did wrong (please!) the PR is at https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/10411
Is that `pip` going to default to python3?
Oh nm, I see what you did there. Just made pip2 more consistent
Yeah. Tried to clean that up a bit, as well as do some things to hopefully cut down on the docker image size a bit (combining all the RUNs into one, for instance)
If you wanted to try an ad hoc py3 build, you could add a test to the pipeline script here https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/py3/
Oof. An SSL cert expired 424 days ago? That’s rough.

super helpful David! Let’s get Sudeep’s sign-off on this PR before we merge — but it makes sense. This will be very helpful to plow through the rest of the Docker containers once we get Sudeep’s sign-off on the approach!
Looking at the PR now folks!
Thanks for all the notes! I'll take a look at the file-server Dockerfile, implement the changes, and have you take another look on Monday. Have a wonderful weekend!
No worries! Happy to jump on a call too. Have a good weekend!
